multiplechoiceresponse.p:
Examine this argument:
Exercising daily helps prevent heart attacks. Don exercises daily. Therefore, Don will probably never suffer a heart attack.
multiplechoiceresponse.label: Does this inductive argument seem to be strong or weak?

div.p: This is weak because there are a lot of other factors that would need to be considered before one can determine whether Don is a heart attack candidate. One data point generally is not sufficient to determine the probability that a conclusion is true. More importantly, there is a logical disconnect between the concept of "prevention" and Don "never" suffering a heart attack. Prevention is a relatively weak concept and never is an absolute concept. The former doesn't support the latter inductively.
